SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface TopologyDataSubmissionService3.VerifiedSubmission3

Enclosing interface:
TopologyDataSubmissionService3
public static interface TopologyDataSubmissionService3.VerifiedSubmission3

This interface can be used to track and optionally retransmit a verified data submission. All retransmissions of verified data must be done through this interface.

A submission for which all of wasAccepted(), wasDropped(), and isInProgress() return false is either still in transit between FglAM and the server, or has been lost without FglAM or the server being aware of it. In the former case, the status can be checked periodically or after a call to awaitStatusChange(long, TimeUnit).

Do to the nature of the network communications user between FglAM and upstream concentrators or servers, a message which has been lost without record cannot be directly reported. To detect this case you should use the TopologyDataSubmissionService3.VerifiedSubmission3 to request an update on the status using requestStatusUpdate() and then wait for the update using awaitStatusChange(long, TimeUnit). After the update has been received, if the status is still unknown, then it can be assumed that the message has been dropped and should be retransmitted with resubmitData().

Method Detail

awaitStatusChange

boolean awaitStatusChange(long time,
                          java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Causes the current thread to wait until it is signaled or interrupted, or the specified waiting time elapses. All waiting threads will be signaled as soon as the status of this submission changes.

Parameters:
time - the maximum time to wait
timeUnit - the time unit of the time argument
Returns:
false if the waiting time detectably elapsed before return from the method, else true
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted (and interruption of thread suspension is supported)

close

void close()
Cleans up all tracking information related to this submission. Closing the submission is not required, but does help free resources more quickly than they otherwise might be.

getStatusText

java.lang.String getStatusText()
Gets an text associated with the current status. This will return null if there is no text associated with the current status.

Returns:
The text associated with the status or null if there is no text available.

isInProgress

boolean isInProgress()
Check (without blocking) whether or not the data associated with this submission has been received by the server and is awaiting processing. The data submission can still be dropped after this point. This does not involve any network queries, but rather checks whether or not notification of a successful submission has been received by the local FglAM.

Returns:
true if the data was received by the server, but is still awaiting processing and false if the data is not awaiting processing.

requestStatusUpdate

void requestStatusUpdate()
Sends a request to update the status of the associated data submission to all upstream servers and concentrators. This method does not block. The message will only be transmitted if final disposition of the submission is not yet know. Specifically, it will not transmit the update request if the submission is known to have been dropped or accepted.

resubmitData

void resubmitData()
                  throws TopologyException
Requests that the data be resubmitted. No timestamps will be changed from the original submission. If the server has already accepted the original submission, but that information has not made its way back to FglAM, this re-submission will be silently discarded by the server and wasAccepted() for this object will return true.

There is no way to determine if the server accepted the original submission or a retransmission.

Throws:
TopologyException - If the server is not currently available or if the data is known to have already been accepted by the server. A TopologyException may also be generated if the agent is submitting verified data too frequently.

wasAccepted

boolean wasAccepted()
Checks (without blocking) whether or not the data associated with this submission has been accepted and processed by the server. This does not involve any network queries, but rather checks whether or not notification of a successful submission has been received by the local FglAM.

Returns:
true if the data was accepted and processed by the server and false if it was not or if the final disposition of the data is not yet know.

wasDropped

boolean wasDropped()
Checks (without blocking) whether or not the data associated with this submission has been accepted and processed by the server. This does not involve any network queries, but rather checks whether or not notification of a successful submission has been received by the local FglAM.

Returns:
true if the data is known to have been dropped and false if it was accepted by the server or if the final disposition of the data is not yet known.
